item.title: Blackstone 将以 100 亿美元收购公寓业主 AIR
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 同意支付约 100 亿美元收购 Apartment Income REIT，这是房地产管理公司看到投资房地产时机成熟的最新迹象。【原文：Blackstone Inc. agreed to pay about $10 billion to acquire Apartment Income REIT, the latest sign that the real estate manager sees a ripe moment to invest in property.】

item.title: 奈德银行首席执行官称南非面临继续被列入 "脏钱 "名单的风险
item.description: 即将离任的南非国民银行集团（Nedbank Group Ltd.）首席执行官表示，南非要想在明年之前从全球黑钱监控名单中除名，还面临着艰巨的任务。【原文：South Africa faces an uphill climb to escape a global dirty-money monitoring list by next year, according to the outgoing chief executive officer of Nedbank Group Ltd.】

item.title: 西班牙将终止房地产黄金签证计划
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）周一表示，西班牙将终止针对投资 50 万欧元（54.12 万美元）以上在该国购房的外国人的黄金签证计划。【原文：Spain will end its golden visa program for foreigners who invest more than €500,000 ($541,200) to buy a house in the country, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said Monday.】

item.title: 大宗商品交易商兑现又一个丰收年
item.description:
在瑞士举行的一次重要峰会上，行业领袖们都带着 "烧钱 "而来。【原文：

Industry leaders are arriving at a key summit in Switzerland with money to burn.

】

item.title: 据说 Road King 和 CVC 正在权衡印尼收费公路的各种方案
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Road King Infrastructure Ltd.和 CVC Capital Partners 正在考虑如何处理其在印尼收费公路中的持股。【原文：Road King Infrastructure Ltd. and CVC Capital Partners are considering options for their holdings in Indonesian toll roads, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 乌克兰债务持有人探讨成立重组委员会
item.description: 据直接了解此事的人士称，乌克兰债务的一些持有者正在商谈在可能的债务重组之前成立债权人委员会。【原文：Some holders of Ukraine’s debt are in talks to form a creditor committee ahead of a potential debt restructuring, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 信誉问题令加拿大央行对降息保持谨慎
item.description: 加拿大央行在抗击通胀的斗争中取得了进展，但行长蒂夫-麦克尔姆（Tiff Macklem）仍有很大的理由对过早启动降息持谨慎态度，因为他的信誉岌岌可危。【原文：The Bank of Canada is making progress in its battle against inflation, but Governor Tiff Macklem still has a big reason to be cautious about launching into rate cuts too soon — his credibility’s on the line.】

item.title: 初级债券购买重镇施罗德将出售旗下一家公司
item.description: 英国资金管理公司施罗德（Schroders Plc）是初级银行债务的最大买家之一。现在，该公司又计划出售次级银行债务。【原文：British money manager Schroders Plc is one of the biggest buyers of junior bank debt. And now in an unusual twist, it’s planning to sell the debt too.】

item.title: 马士基与 Transnet 竞争南非港口合作伙伴人选
item.description: A.P. Moller - Maersk A/S正在与南非国营物流公司Transnet SOC Ltd.为寻找合作伙伴开发撒哈拉以南非洲最大的集装箱港口而进行的程序进行竞争。【原文：A.P. Moller - Maersk A/S is contesting a process held by South Africa’s state logistics firm Transnet SOC Ltd. to find a partner to develop sub-Saharan Africa’s biggest container port.】

item.title: 英国高昂的住房成本意味着成年子女在家中居住的时间更长
item.description: 由于住房、育儿和学生债务成本高昂，英国的年轻人要比他们的前辈多花几年时间才能达到人生的里程碑，包括离开父母的家和生儿育女。【原文：Britain’s young adults are taking years longer than their predecessors to reach life milestones including leaving their parents’ home and having babies because of the high cost of housing, childcare and student debt.】

item.title: 雷诺超越日产，长达数十年之久的联盟出现动荡
item.description: 雷诺汽车公司（Renault SA）的市值已超过日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.【原文：Renault SA has leapfrogged Nissan Motor Co. in market value as investors rewarded the French carmaker for moves including loosening ties with the struggling Japanese partner.】

item.title: 波士顿考虑提高商业税以应对写字楼市场低迷
item.description: 波士顿市长米歇尔-吴（Michelle Wu）正在寻求提高商业地产税率，以帮助保护房主免受写字楼物业价值历史性下滑的影响。【原文：Boston Mayor Michelle Wu is seeking to raise commercial property tax rates to help protect homeowners from the brunt of the historic slump in office property values.】

item.title: 开普敦及其周边地区遭受暴雨和大风袭击
item.description: 南非的旅游中心开普敦和周边的西开普省遭受了暴雨、狂风和丛林大火的袭击，造成建筑物、道路和其他基础设施的广泛损坏。【原文：Cape Town, South Africa’s tourism hub, and the surrounding Western Cape province have been battered by torrential rains, howling winds and bush fires that caused extensive damage to buildings, roads and other infrastructure.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。美国股市在上周五强势收盘后表现平淡，而国债则因交易商减少对今年降息的押注而下跌。石油从五个月高点回落，黄金则攀升至新纪录。【原文：Good morning. US stock futures are muted after a strong close on Friday, while treasuries drop as traders pare bets for rate cuts this year. Oil retreats from a five month high as gold climbs to a new record.】

item.title: 象牙海岸可可短缺令市场惶恐不安，可可价格攀升
item.description: 可可在纽约市场攀升，因为市场持续担心可可短缺问题，这已经扰乱了市场，并使价格创下历史新高。【原文：Cocoa climbed in New York amid persistent concerns over shortages that have roiled the market and driven prices to a record high.】

item.title: 中国称创新造就电动汽车成功，拒绝欧盟补贴调查
item.description: 中国商务部长在巴黎访问期间表示，中国汽车制造商在电动汽车领域的快速增长是在激烈竞争中不断创新的结果，并拒绝接受欧盟对该行业补贴的调查。【原文：China’s automakers’ fast growth in electric cars follows innovation amid tough competition, the nation’s commerce minister said during a visit in Paris, rejecting the European Union’s probe into subsidies for the sector.】

item.title: 戴蒙将人工智能的变革潜力比作蒸汽机
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）说，人工智能可能是他的银行正在努力解决的最大问题，他将人工智能的潜在影响比作蒸汽机，并表示这项技术可以 "增强几乎所有的工作"。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said artificial intelligence may be the biggest issue his bank is grappling with, likened its potential impact to that of the steam engine and said the technology could “augment virtually every job.”】

item.title: ZiG 开始交易，津巴布韦银行在转换中挣扎
item.description: 津巴布韦的新货币 ZiG 于周一开始交易，这是该国家第六次尝试推出新货币。【原文：ZiG, Zimbabwe’s new currency, began trading on Monday as businesses struggled with the nation’s sixth attempt at introducing a revamped unit.】

item.title: 埃克森正在英国扩建炼油厂，而其他公司正在关闭产能
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）运营的英国最大炼油厂耗资 10 亿美元进行扩建，扩建后的炼油厂将在 2025 年第一季度供应大部分新柴油。【原文：The bulk of new diesel supply stemming from a $1 billion expansion at the UK’s largest oil refinery operated by Exxon Mobil Corp. will be available in the first quarter of 2025.】

item.title: 阿托斯将提交债务计划，Onepoint 支持救援联盟
item.description: 陷入困境的法国 IT 公司 Atos SE 将于下周一提交一份债务重组计划，该公司的第一大股东 Onepoint 正寻求建立一个联盟，以提出另一个拯救计划。【原文：Embattled French IT company Atos SE will present a debt restructuring plan on Monday, as the company’s top shareholder Onepoint seeks to build a coalition to offer an alternative rescue plan.】

item.title: 全基金、英国股票在调查中被视为最受欢迎的并购目标
item.description: 随着最低估值引发英国股票并购热潮，今年将有更多英国公司成为收购目标。【原文：More UK firms are tipped to be takeover targets this year as rock-bottom valuations spark an M&A boom among the country’s stocks.】

item.title: 美国和菲律宾士兵在更大规模军事演习前进行训练
item.description: 菲律宾称，约 3500 名菲律宾和美国士兵已开始在其主要吕宋岛进行年度联合训练，此前一天，盟国与日本和澳大利亚在南中国海举行了演习。【原文：The Philippines said around 3,500 Filipino and American soldiers have started their annual joint training on its main Luzon island, a day after the allied nations held drills with Japan and Australia in the South China Sea.】

item.title: 瑞典央行行长呼吁谨慎宽松以避免需求激增
item.description: 2023 年 6 月 29 日星期四，瑞典斯德哥尔摩，瑞典央行行长 Erik Thedeen 在政策利率新闻发布会后接受广播采访。瑞典央行提高了借贷成本，并承诺加快债券销售，以应对顽固的通货膨胀和疲软的货币，同时寻求限制对脆弱的房地产行业的影响。摄影师Erik Flyg/Bloomberg【原文：Erik Thedeen, governor of the Riksbank, gives a broadcast interview following a policy rate news conference in Stockholm, Sweden, on Thursday, June 29, 2023. Sweden's Riksbank raised borrowing costs and pledged accelerated bond sales, a response to stubborn inflation and a weak currency while seeking to limit fallout on a vulnerable real estate sector. Photographer: Erik Flyg/Bloomberg】

item.title: 月亮遮住太阳能电池板，日食将使美国太阳能发电量减少 30 千兆瓦
item.description: 在周一的日全食期间，美国将损失超过 30 千兆瓦的太阳能，大约相当于 30 个核反应堆的发电量。【原文：The US will lose more than 30 gigawatts of solar energy during Monday’s total eclipse — roughly the output of 30 nuclear reactors — as sunlight is blocked during prime generating hours.】

item.title: 法拉利开设电池实验室，电动超级跑车竞争白热化
item.description: 法拉利公司（Ferrari NV）推出了一个研究锂电池芯的新实验室，准备在明年年底前生产出第一辆全电动超级跑车。【原文：Ferrari NV unveiled a new laboratory to research lithium battery cells as it gears up to produce its first fully electric supercar by late next year.】

item.title: 俄罗斯第一季度收入因油价上涨而大幅增长
item.description: 俄罗斯第一季度财政收入大幅增长，部分原因是一次性税收支付和油价上涨，该国继续经受住因乌克兰战争而受到的制裁。【原文：Russia reported a sharp increase in revenue in the first quarter due in part to one-time tax payments and rising oil prices as the country continues to weather sanctions over its war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 尼日利亚将于 5 月获得由石油支持的 10 亿美元非洲进出口银行贷款
item.description: 尼日利亚将在 5 月底之前从石油支持的银团贷款中获得 10.5 亿美元，以帮助振兴其经济并增加当地外汇市场的硬通货供应。【原文：Nigeria is set to receive $1.05 billion from a syndicated loan backed by oil by the end of May to help revive its economy and boost the supply of hard currency on the local foreign-exchange market.】

item.title: 华尔街将欧洲视为股市下一轮反弹的赢家
item.description: 华尔街的策略师们推荐欧洲股票而非美国股票，因为经济前景的改善和接近历史记录的折扣推动了科技行业以外的收益。【原文：Wall Street strategists are recommending European equities over their US peers as an improving economic outlook and near-record discounts drive gains beyond the technology industry.】

item.title: 维托尔公司第二年盈利130亿美元
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，维托尔集团 2023 年的利润约为 130 亿美元，这标志着全球最大的独立石油贸易商连续第二年实现盈利丰收。【原文：Vitol Group posted a profit of about $13 billion for 2023, according to a person familiar with the matter, marking the second consecutive year of bumper earnings for the world’s biggest independent oil trader.】

item.title: 尼日利亚前中央银行行长对新指控认罪
item.description: 尼日利亚前中央银行行长戈德温-埃梅菲勒（Godwin Emefiele）周一对该国一家金融监督机构对他提出的新的外币违规指控表示不认罪。【原文：Former Central Bank of Nigeria Governor Godwin Emefiele pleaded not guilty Monday to new allegations of foreign-currency infractions brought against him by one of the country’s finance watchdogs.】
